intro: Adenocarpus boudyi, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a common feature in the Malvaceae family. Adenocarpus boudyi is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
